intro: Paraspalathus sericea, commonly known as the silky spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, succulent stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many other spurge species. Paraspalathus sericea is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in semi-arid conditions.
